fixes.name: Measure Selector
fixes.dax_expression:
SWITCH(
    SELECTEDVALUE('Measure Selector Param'[Display As]),
    "Profit", SUM('Orders (Sample - Superstore)'[Profit]),
    "Sales", SUM('Orders (Sample - Superstore)'[Sales])
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted the Tableau CASE on the parameter to a DAX SWITCH using SELECTEDVALUE('Measure Selector Param'[Display As]) and aggregated the selected column with SUM to match SUM([Measure Selector]) behavior.
fixes.type_changed_reason: The calculation references a Tableau parameter, and all parameter-based calculations must be created as measures.

fixes.name: Min - Max value
fixes.dax_expression:
VAR current = [Measure Selector]
VAR windowMax = MAXX(ALLSELECTED('Orders (Sample - Superstore)'), [Measure Selector])
VAR windowMin = MINX(ALLSELECTED('Orders (Sample - Superstore)'), [Measure Selector])
RETURN
IF(
    current = windowMax || current = windowMin,
    current
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Translated the Tableau table calculation comparing SUM([Measure Selector]) to WINDOW_MAX/WINDOW_MIN into DAX by computing the aggregated Measure Selector as a measure, then using MAXX/MINX over ALLSELECTED('Orders (Sample - Superstore)') to emulate the windowed max/min and returning the current measure when it equals the window max or min.
fixes.type_changed_reason: The calculation contains aggregations and table calculations (WINDOW_MAX/WINDOW_MIN), so it should be implemented as a measure.
